I agree with your translation, "Sanctioning Iran's economy," as the most accurate English equivalent of the Chinese text "制裁伊朗的经济." 

The term "制裁" in Chinese directly translates to "sanction" in English, which refers to the action of imposing penalties or other punitive measures. In this context, it specifically refers to economic sanctions. "伊朗的经济" translates to "Iran's economy," indicating the target of the sanctions. Therefore, "Sanctioning Iran's economy" accurately conveys the meaning of the original Chinese text by indicating the punitive measures taken against Iran's economy.
